name: Dalhousie Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a surprise weekend away for me ending in our engagement!!! A beautiful place to propose and it looked a lovely venue for the weddings too! The food was exceptional and so were the staff and service. We stayed in the mary queen of scotts room (this isn't on their website but I would highly recommend it) After concierge (who was also awesome) found out about our engagement we had a card posted through our door to congratulate us!! This was the best weekend of my life and dalhousie castle and the staff made it all complete (along with a big sparkly ring!!!)
reviews.title: A truly magical experience

reviews.text: We where married in September and the castle was a fantastic adventure. You cannot help but love the Dalhousie Castle and go with the thought that king and queens have stayed their. The idea of spirits roaming the corridors and rooms adds to the experience. Set in beautiful grounds will only add to it. If there is a negative it has to be down to human intervention and I only say this having paid £295.00 for photography to be rushed on the day and then feeling disappointed with the overall finish. Again another nice touch would have been for the staff who coordinate weddings to have greeted us on the wedding morning to let us know the protocols for the day but not to worry there are worse things in life.
reviews.title: Dalhousie photography

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked an overnight stay at the castle lodge through Laterooms. We were not sure what to expect but were very pleasantly surprised. We found our way to the castle driveway and were presented with a very pretty picture of a beautiful red castle standing in late afternoon autumn sunshine, stunning. we drove in and struggled a bit to find reception, we followed a taxi and found it round the back of the castle. The staff were very friendly and helpful and guided us to the lodge, a separate building tucked away in a lovely quiet spot over a very narrow bridge. We found our room on the first floor, the room was warm, bright and very clean, a very welcoming place. As we arrived early, we went for a walk until darkness and then made our way back to the Lodge and decided to try the spa and sauna in the lodge.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to my brothers party and returned late, no problems at all. We rose on Sunday morning in a very quiet and serene spot with virtually no noise from the usual hotel and kitchen fans etc as the lodge is on its own well away from the main buildings of the castle, we walked up to the castle for breakfast which was sumptuous and served by very friendly and attentive staff in the west facing Orangery restaurant in the conservatory, watching the mist lift and the wildlife getting busy, a fox ran across the field as we watched.
reviews.title: Great stay but marked down for a service issue

reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience and we would recommend a stay here to anyone, an oasis away from the bright lights of Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Haunted castle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights, 12th and 13th October. There was a very loud wedding going on the first night. Our room was below the function room so we had the annoying boom boom booming vibrating though out the room and couldn't get to sleep. We phoned reception and the person who answered the phone put me on hold then came back to tell me he had spoken to the manager and that the music would stop at 12 midnight. (It was already past this time). We waited a further 15 minutes when my head was pounding to be told the music would go on until 1pm. I asked to get moved room and explained my head was pounding and was told it was not possible as the hotel was full. I asked to speak to the manager and was told he had gone home after my first call !!!!!! - obviously knowing fine that I would be phoning back to complain again, leaving the staff member to deal with me.
reviews.title: CHECK YOU CREDIT/BANK CARD STATEMENT CAREFULLY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning I complained again to reception about the noise and lack of sleep and asked to speak to the manager. It was not possible - I can't remember what excuse I was given. I was attending a wedding myself that day so did not have time to wait around.
reviews.title: Very Good Stay
Have afternoon tea, do a historical tour, watch someone else's wedding and then leave.
reviews.text: When we checked out and went to pay our bill I was going to ask again to speak to the manager about this. (I could not understand why we were allocated a room under a function hall when we were not going to be at the function. Surely it would have made more sense to allocate that room to someone who was going to be at the wedding!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we when we went to settle our bill we were told our bill had been taken care of. We asked the receptionist if she was sure and she said yes, smiled and walked away.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed
Beautiful Castle
reviews.text: We thought this was particularly generous of the hotel to waive the cost of our 2 night stay especially since the 2nd night was fine. We would have been happy with an apology and only having the first night waived.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Castle!
reviews.text: Stayed recently and paid top dollar for the beautiful De Ramseia Bedroom. We loved the room but the bathroom needs to be cleaned up and revamped. My check in experience was less than stellar. We ate dinner in the dungeon, fantastic! Great food and service! Breakfast the next day was perfect too!

My friend was given an afternoon tea voucher for her birthday and invited me to come with her. For the price, I expected something better. After arriving at a tiny reception area and told to follow the signs for the conservatory, we eventually found it. We were given a glass of champagne, then given a small pot of tea with one tea bag. Not very exciting. I thought there would be a choice. The tea had to be stirred and stirred to get any colour, presumable a cheap tea bag. The cake stand came with sandwiches, scones and cakes but nothing very exciting. The conservatory was covered in plastic plants. I'd rather there was no greenery rather than plastic.
reviews.title: afternoon tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Simundus De Ramseia Bedroom. I really liked the room and the feeling but the bathroom is a bit worn down. The surrounding landscape is very nice. The dungeon restaurant had very good food, and the breakfast in the Orangery was also very good.
reviews.title: Excellent but a bit worn down

reviews.text: I wish that they had given a paper with the layout of the castle, or if they could have given a tour of the castle when we arrived.
reviews.title: Fabulous history and location, a bit pretentious and over priced. The Bar steward needs sorting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there on a Saturday, and I guess that there are weddings there most Saturdays. You could hear some of the music from the party when you are in the room, it was however not loud.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Castle experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at many hotels in my life and this is something else.
reviews.title: Something different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute you enter they are offering to help in every way but not in a pushy way.
reviews.title: Amazing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a bitterly cold night but we had a quick look around in the dark and they said that after checkout we could stay on to looked around.
reviews.title: Beautiful Castle
Tired and overpriced
reviews.text: We did so and was shown around saw the birds out of their cages and the areas and was told about the history and some stories.

description: Dalhousie Castle Hotel and Spa - a magnificent 13th century fortress set within acres of wooded parkland on the picturesque banks of the River Esk. From the moment you arrive at Dalhousie Castle, one of the finest luxury hotels in Scotland, a warm Scottish welcome awaits. Whether relaxing in the The Spa, enjoying one of the library's extensive collection of books and a drink from the 'secret bar' next to the open fire, dining in the ancient barrel vaulted dungeon on our exceptional cuisine or relaxing in your unique castle bedroom, you will always feel as welcome as the 'Laird'.
